label: Description
value: Head slightly lifted to its left. Wings extending from shoulders. Painted flesh colors, with pink and blue accents on wings.  Nail driven into back of head for suspension. Glass eyes

label: Description
value: Two cherubs’ heads, with wings growing out from shoulders. One, behind and above the other, has curly hair and parted lips showing two teeth. Painted in flesh colors, with pink and blue accents on wings. Glass eyes.

label: Description
value: Round knob of wood inlaid with silver in designs of three circles, formed by bands of stripes, dots and conventionalized figures.

label: Description
value: Round knob on short stem of wood, inlaid with silver. top has a star design; sides, stripes and zig-zags in circular bands; stem has perpendicular design of small conventionalized pattern and diamond in stripes.

label: Description
value: Small round knob, slightly flattened, set on short stem; wood inlaid in silver in completely conventionalized design; formed of small lines, dots in circular pattern or perpendicular pattern on stem.
Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique..., Plate 1

label: Description
value: Three mechanical objects on stands pierced with strapwork decoration, probably intended to be carried out in metal, or ivory. Two alternative schemes are given for the vertical members joining small, regularly-placed disc. Numbered fig. 1, 2, 3.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 3, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Designs for mechanical objects, to be carried out in metal or ivory. These are concentric geometrical shapes, the outer-most in each case being a sphere, with six holes facing front. Figure 11, in the center, is mounted on a tall spindle, with a trefoil or fleur-de-lys at the top of the sphere (similar to figure 10).

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 4, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Designs for mechanical objects to be carried out in metal or ivory. The central figure (12) is the largest, and like those in Plate 3, is spherical, but has more holes apparent. Inside are loose barrel-like shapes; figure 4, an indented sphere. Lower right, a quadrilateral triangle, with merging points. Lower left and righ, cubes.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 5, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Seven designs for mechanical objects. Six are presumably able to be mounted on the stand for fig. 17, a sphere with a rod protruding laterally. Figure 23 is a sphere with circular gaps around a dimensional fleur-de-lys.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Plate 10, from Recueil d'ouvrages curieux de mathématique et de mécanique, ou description du cabinet de Monsieur Grollier de Servière

label: Description
value: Designs for a container and related mechanical devices, to be carried out in metal or ivory. The top half is a cylinder, with a beaded point. The larger lower section rests on three feet. Left, a long (threaded?) spool, to the right, another. Above, a composit cylinidrical piece; small cylinder around a larger one.

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

Passementerie, Façon de passer le Patron par devant

label: Description
value: Picture from Diderot's Encyclopedia showing a man at a loom; scale. Beneath, textile patterns that the loom can create. All pictures are labelled with figure numbers.

label: Dimensions
value: Sheet: 35.6 x 22.7 cm (14 in. x 8 15/16 in.), irregular Platemark: 35.5 x 22.8 cm (14 x 9 in.)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Passementerie, Façon de passer le Patron par derriere

label: Description
value: A depiction of a man working at a loom. Beneath, designs for the textile that he is creating.

label: Dimensions
value: 35.6 x 22.4 cm (14 in. x 8 13/16 in.), irregular

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: A man working at the loom as four women twist the material. Scale below.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler

label: Description
value: A depiction of the various tools used by embroiderers and patterns for stitched knots. Each is labeled with a figure number.

label: Provenance
value: Kubler Collection (transferred from the Cooper Union Picture Library)

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
Tailleur d'Habits, outils, from Diderot's Encyclopaedia

label: Description
value: Drawing divided into two registers. On top, a view of a tailor shop. On far left bottom, a man crouched under a table irons clothing. Seated on a table, four women sew clothing. At right, a tailor takes a man's measurements. Far right, a man cuts fabric. In the bottom register, depictions of the tools used by tailors, all given figure labels.

label: Dimensions
value: 35.6 x 22.6 cm (14 in. x 8 7/8 in.), irregular

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. George A. Kubler
View of Union Square after the Announcement of the Nomination of Horatio Seymoure by the Democratic National Convention

label: Description
value: View of Union Square, New York, showing crowds gathered in a political rally. Caption reads: Popular Demonstration on Union Square, New York City, July 9th, immediately after the announcement of the nomination of Horatio Seymoure by the Democratic National Convention

label: Provenance
value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum

Madison Square, New York, in the Evening

label: Description
value: Madison Square, New York, in the evening. Snow is on the ground.  The square is illuminated by a cluster of electric lights. Caption reads: The Electric Light in Madison Square, New York. Illustration from Harper's Weekly.

value: Mrs. George A. Kubler; 1949: acquired by the Museum
